Our colleagues at the University of California Irvine reported cases in patients living outside the endemic region. This represents a concerning trend—coccidioidomycosis has recently been identified in the soil in Oregon,
3 and diagnosed in patients in Washington with negative travel histories.
4 County-based data from the California Department of Public Health reveal that the recent epidemic mainly affected the Central Valley. However, certain counties outside this region (including Los Angeles and San Luis Obispo counties) have seen a consistent increase in cases during the last 6 years.
